title: Heavy rainfall expected in several parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that atmospheric conditions are favorable for thunderstorms in the evening.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentenced to more than 4 years in prison over prostitution conviction
byline: Sean “Diddy” Combs was sentenced on Friday to more than four years in prison over his conviction on prostitution-related charges, with the judge rebuking the hip-hop mogul for subjecting two former girlfriends to years of abuse.

title: Israel says it is preparing to implement the ‘first stage of Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel is preparing to implement the “first stage” of U.S. President Donald Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza.

title: Tunisian sentenced to death for Facebook posts criticising president
byline: A Tunisian man has been sentenced to death on charges of insulting the president and assaulting state security through posts on social media, the head of the Tunisian League for Human Rights and his lawyer said on Friday.

title: Pavement trading prohibited in Hatton during Diwali festival
byline: The Hatton-Dickoya Urban Council has generated an income of over Rs. 3.6 million by tendering 146 plots of land temporarily allocated for business activities during the upcoming Diwali (Deepavali) festival season.

title: World Bank stresses urgent energy sector reforms in Sri Lanka
byline: The World Bank has emphasized the urgent need for energy sector reforms in Sri Lanka, warning that the country continues to bear significantly higher energy costs than others in the region.

title: Motorcycle rider in shooting incident near Dehiwala railway station arrested
byline: A suspect has been arrested in connection with the shooting incident and attempted murder of a person near the Dehiwala Railway Station, police said.

title: Sri Lanka’s post-crisis recovery strong, debt restructuring nearly complete – IMF
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) says Sri Lanka’s economic reform program continues to make “impressive progress,” with the country showing strong signs of recovery under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement.

title: Munich airport shuts again over drone scare
byline: Munich airport was forced to halt operations for the second day in a row on Friday (Oct 3) over drone sightings, with dozens of flights and more than 6,000 passengers affected.

title: Bulletproof vehicle provided for Mahinda Rajapaksa’s security returned
byline: The bulletproof vehicle provided for the security of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has been returned.

title: Two vendors fined for selling ‘Keeri Samba’ at inflated prices
byline: Two traders found guilty of selling Keeri Samba rice at inflated prices have each been fined Rs. 100,000, in orders issued by the Kalutara and Panadura Magistrate’s Courts.

title: US considers $1 Trump coin to mark 250th independence celebrations
byline: The U.S. Treasury is considering making a $1 coin featuring President Donald Trump to commemorate 250 years since the declaration of American independence in 2026, it said on Friday.

title: Rashmika Mandanna & Vijay Deverakonda reportedly engaged
byline: Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna reportedly got engaged on Friday at a private ceremony attended only by family and close friends. According to reports, the wedding is scheduled for February next year.

title: Japan’s Takaichi set to become country’s first female PM
byline: Japan’s ruling party picked conservative nationalist Sanae Takaichi as its new head on Saturday, putting her on course to become the country’s first female prime minister.

title: Heavy rainfall expected to continue in several provinces
byline: The Meteorology Department states that atmospheric conditions are favorable for thunderstorms in the evening.

title: Afghan Taliban foreign minister to visit India for first time
byline: Afghanistan’s Taliban foreign minister will visit India this month after the UN Security Council Committee temporarily lifted a travel ban, Kabul’s foreign ministry confirmed to AFP on Saturday (Oct 4).

title: PUCSL to decide on CEB’s proposed electricity tariff hike by Mid-October
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced that it will issue its decision on the Ceylon Electricity Board’s (CEB) proposal to increase electricity tariffs by the end of the second week of this month.

title: NIE expands program to brief principals on new education reforms
byline: In line with the new education reforms, the National Institute of Education (NIE) has commenced programs to brief principals of both national and provincial schools at the district level across all provinces.

title: Dy. Minister clarifies misleading reports on President’s 2026 expenditure
byline: Reports circulating on social media claiming that the President’s expenditure allocation for 2026 has been increased threefold has been clarified by the Minister of Labour and Deputy Minister of Economic Development, Dr. Anil Jayantha Fernando.

title: Govt to continue renewable energy projects uninterrupted - Energy Minister
byline: The Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody has stated that the renewable energy projects initiated by the government will continue to implemented without interruption.

title: Backhoe Saman’s brother-in-law arrested in Biyagama
byline: The brother-in-law of notorious underworld criminal “Backhoe Saman” has been arrested in Biyagama along with drugs and a firearm.

title: Magnitude 6 earthquake strikes east coast of Honshu, Japan
byline: An magnitude 6 earthquake struck near the east coast of Honshu, Japan, on Saturday, the German Research Center for Geosciences (GFZ) said.

title: CID confirms ‘Kajja’ followed Wasim Thajudeen’s car before murder
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has confirmed that Aruna Vidanagamage, also known as “Kajja”, was travelling in the jeep that followed rugby player Wasim Thajudeen’s car moments before his death.
